types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Direction
types.description: A direction relative to an initial position.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this IntrospectTest.

types.name: IntrospectTestID
types.description: The `IntrospectTestID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type IntrospectTest.

types.name: Line
types.description: A line connecting two points.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Line.

types.name: LineID
types.description: The `LineID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Line.

types.name: Point
types.description: A point in 2D space.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Point.

types.name: PointID
types.description: The `PointID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Point.

fields.name: loadIntrospectTestFromID
fields.description: Load a IntrospectTest from its ID.

args.name: reason
args.value: The given ID ultimately determines the purity of its result.

fields.name: loadLineFromID
fields.description: Load a Line from its ID.

args.name: reason
args.value: The given ID ultimately determines the purity of its result.

fields.name: loadPointFromID
fields.description: Load a Point from its ID.

args.name: reason
args.value: The given ID ultimately determines the purity of its result.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: _DirectiveApplication
types.description: A GraphQL schema directive application.

types.name: _DirectiveApplicationArg
types.description: A GraphQL schema directive application arg.

types.name: __Directive
types.description: A GraphQL schema directive.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A location that a directive may be applied.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: A possible value of a GraphQL enum.

types.name: __Field
types.description: A GraphQL object or input field.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: A GraphQL schema input field or argument.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL schema definition.

types.name: __Type
types.description: A GraphQL schema type.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: The kind of a GraphQL type.

args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
args.name: reason

directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.
directives.name: deprecated

args.description: Explains why this element is impure, i.e. whether it performs side effects or yield a different result with the same arguments.
args.name: reason

directives.description: Indicates that a field may resolve to different values when called repeatedly with the same inputs, or that the field has side effects. Impure fields are never cached.
directives.name: impure

directives.description: Indicates that a field's selection can be removed from any query without changing the result. Meta fields are dropped from cache keys.
directives.name: meta

directives.description: Indicates the source information for where a given field is defined.
directives.name: sourceMap
